citation.article-title: Longispora albida gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel genus of the family Micromonosporaceae
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Longispora (Lon.gi.spo′ra. L. adj. longus long; Gr. fem. n. spora spore; N.L. fem. n. Longispora long spore).
Cells are Gram-positive, aerobic, non-acid-fast and non-motile.
Spore-chains are straight and have more than 20 spores on the tip of short sporophores that branch from vegetative mycelia.
Cell-wall peptidoglycan contains meso-DAP, glycine and alanine; arabinose, galactose and xylose are detected in whole-cell hydrolysates.
Predominant menaquinones are MK-10(H4) and MK-10(H6); a minor component is MK-10(H8).
The diagnostic phospholipid is phosphatidylethanolamine (phospholipid type II).
The type species is Longispora albida.
